Module PSP24
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Book

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Book
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Book extends Object implements Serializable
Book Class: contains the disposition of the cards of the player
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Book

      public Book(int rows, int columns)
      Constructs a Book object with the specified number of rows, columns, and a PlayableCard. Initializes the resource and symbol maps and sets up the book matrix with Cell objects. Each Cell object is initialized with its row and column indices and is marked as unavailable.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the book.
      columns - The number of columns in the book.

  • Method Details

    • initializePrintMatrix

      public void initializePrintMatrix()
      Initializes the matrix used for printing.

      This method sets up a two-dimensional array of strings with dimensions specified by the constant DefaultValue.BookSizeMax. Each element of the array is initialized to a single space character (" ").

      The matrix is a square array with both rows and columns equal to DefaultValue.BookSizeMax.

    • initializeMaps

      public void initializeMaps()
      Initializes the maps used for tracking resources and symbols. This method sets up two HashMaps: resourceMap and symbolMap. The resourceMap is initialized with keys from the ResourceType enum (Animal, Fungi, Insect, Plant) and their corresponding values are set to 0. The symbolMap is initialized with keys from the SymbolType enum (Ink, Quill, Manuscript) and their corresponding values are set to 0.

    • getCellinMatrix

      public Cell getCellinMatrix(Cell findCell)
      Retrieves a cell from the matrix that matches the specified cell. This method searches through the bookMatrix for a cell that is equal to the specified findCell. If a matching cell is found, it is returned. If no matching cell is found, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      findCell - the cell to find in the matrix
      Returns:
      the matching cell if found, otherwise null

    • getInitialCard

      public PlayableCard getInitialCard()

    • addInitial

      public void addInitial(PlayableCard initialCard)
      Adds the initial playable card to a specific cell in the matrix.

      This method places the initial card in the cell located at position (35, 35) in the bookMatrix. It updates the cell's availability, sets the card pointer, and marks the cell as occupied and as a wall. The method also updates the resource map and the book based on the initial card's properties.

      Parameters:
      initialCard - the initial playable card to be placed in the matrix

    • UpdateMapInitial

      public void UpdateMapInitial(PlayableCard initialCard)
      Updates the resource map based on the provided initial card. This method evaluates the presence of resources in the initial card, which can have resources both on the corners of the card and in the central part.
      Parameters:
      initialCard - The initial card to update the resource map with.

    • addResourceCard

      public int addResourceCard(PlayableCard resourceCard, Cell cell) throws CellNotAvailableException
      Places a resource card onto a cell in the game and returns the points earned by that card.
      Parameters:
      resourceCard - The resource card to be placed.
      cell - The cell onto which the card will be placed.
      Returns:
      The points earned by placing the card on the cell. Returns 0 if the card has no points.
      Throws:
      CellNotAvailableException

    • addGoldCard

      public int addGoldCard(PlayableCard goldCard, Cell cell) throws PlacementConditionViolated, CellNotAvailableException
      Adds a gold card to the specified cell and calculates the number of points gained.
      Parameters:
      goldCard - The gold card to be added.
      cell - The cell where the gold card will be placed.
      Returns:
      The number of victory points gained by adding the gold card.
      Throws:
      PlacementConditionViolated - If the placement condition for the gold card is not met.
      CellNotAvailableException

    • checkPlacementCondition

      public boolean checkPlacementCondition(PlayableCard goldCard)
      Checks if the placement condition of a given gold card is satisfied based on the available resources.
      Parameters:
      goldCard - The gold card whose placement condition needs to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if the placement condition is satisfied, false otherwise.

    • checkGoldPoints

      public int checkGoldPoints(PlayableCard goldCard, Cell cell)
      Checks the points earned by a gold card based on its conditions.
      Parameters:
      goldCard - The gold card to be checked.
      cell - The cell associated with the gold card.
      Returns:
      The number of points earned by the gold card.
      See Also:
      • checkGoldCornerCondition(Cell)
      • checkGoldSymbolCondition(PlayableCard)

    • checkGoldCornerCondition

      public int checkGoldCornerCondition(Cell cell)
      Calculates the points obtained from a GoldCard with the "cornerCondition" by counting the corners covered. Returns two points for each corner covered by the GoldCard.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell containing the GoldCard.
      Returns:
      The points obtained from the GoldCard based on covered corners.

    • checkGoldSymbolCondition

      public int checkGoldSymbolCondition(PlayableCard goldCard)
      Checks the gold symbol condition of a playable gold card.
      Parameters:
      goldCard - The gold card to be checked.
      Returns:
      The number of occurrences of the gold card's symbol condition in a symbol map.

    • addCard

      public int addCard(PlayableCard card, Cell cell) throws PlacementConditionViolated, CellNotAvailableException
      Adds a playable card to a cell and returns the number of points earned.
      Parameters:
      card - The playable card to be added.
      cell - The cell to which the card will be added.
      Returns:
      The number of points earned by adding the card to the cell.
      Throws:
      PlacementConditionViolated
      CellNotAvailableException

    • updateCoveredCorners

      public boolean updateCoveredCorners(Cell cell)
      Updates the covered corners of the neighboring cards of the specified cell. If a neighboring cell contains a card and its corner is not empty, the corresponding resource or symbol in the book's resource/symbol map is decremented.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell for which to update the covered corners of neighboring cards.
      Returns:
      True if any corner was covered, false otherwise.

    • coverCorner

      public void coverCorner(PlayableCard card, int corner)
      Covers the resource or symbol of a specified corner on a PlayableCard. Decreases the quantity of the corresponding resource or symbol in the book's resource/symbol map.
      Parameters:
      card - The PlayableCard for which the corner is to be covered.
      corner - The type of corner to cover (0: TLCorner, 1: TRCorner, 2: BRCorner, 3: BLCorner).

    • decreaseResource

      public void decreaseResource(ResourceType resourceType)
      Decreases the quantity of the specified type of resource by one.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - The type of resource to decrease.

    • decreaseSymbol

      public void decreaseSymbol(SymbolType symbolType)
      Decreases the quantity of the specified type of symbol by one.
      Parameters:
      symbolType - The type of symbol to decrease.

    • increaseResource

      public void increaseResource(ResourceType resourceType)
      Increases the quantity of the specified type of resource by one.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - The type of resource to increase.

    • increaseSymbol

      public void increaseSymbol(SymbolType symbolType)
      Increases the quantity of the specified type of symbol by one.
      Parameters:
      symbolType - The type of symbol to increase.

    • updateMaps

      public void updateMaps(PlayableCard card, Cell cell)
      Updates the symbol map and the resource map when adding a new card to the book. This method updates the symbol map and the resource map by calling the updateNewCardCorners(PlayableCard) method to incorporate symbols and/or resources from the newly added card, and the updateCoveredCorners(Cell) method to adjust the resource and symbol counts based on the neighboring cards of the specified cell.
      Parameters:
      card - The PlayableCard to add to the book.
      cell - The cell where the card is placed.

    • updateNewCardCorners

      public void updateNewCardCorners(PlayableCard card)
      Updates the resource and symbol maps with the symbols and/or resources present on a card when it is placed in the book.
      Parameters:
      card - The PlayableCard to update the resource and symbol maps with.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all cards from the book. This method clears the book of all cards, leaving it empty.

    • updateBook

      public void updateBook(PlayableCard newCard, Cell cell)
      Updates the availability of cells surrounding the newly placed card. This method adjusts the availability of cells surrounding the newly placed card based on the presence of corners on the card. If a corner exists on the card and the adjacent diagonal cell does not have its wall attribute set to true, it sets the adjacent diagonal cell to available. If the corner does not exist (NoCorner), the availability of the cell remains false, and the cell's wall attribute is set to true, indicating that no further cards can be placed in that cell in the future.
      Parameters:
      newCard - The PlayableCard that has been placed.
      cell - The Cell where the card is placed.

    • showAvailableCells

      public ArrayList<Cell> showAvailableCells()
      Returns an array of available cells in the book matrix. A cell is considered available if its 'isAvailable' attribute is set to true.
      Returns:
      An array of Cell objects representing the available cells in the book matrix.

    • getResourceMap

      public Map<ResourceType,Integer> getResourceMap()

    • setResourceMap

      public void setResourceMap(Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceMap)

    • getSymbolMap

      public Map<SymbolType,Integer> getSymbolMap()

    • setSymbolMap

      public void setSymbolMap(Map<SymbolType,Integer> symbolMap)

    • checkGoal

      public int checkGoal(ObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      This method checks on the player's Book how many times he achieved his own Goal. It also calculates how many points the player obtained achieving his Goal.
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - Is the player's own ObjectiveCard.
      Returns:
      Victory Points obtained by the player reaching the goal required by his Objective card.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an invalid GoalType label is set on the objectiveCard attribute.

    • checkResourceCondition

      public int checkResourceCondition(ObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - The player's own ObjectiveCard.
      Returns:
      Victory Points obtained by the player reaching the Resource condition required by his Objective card.

    • checkSymbolCondition

      public int checkSymbolCondition(ObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - The player's own ObjectiveCard.
      Returns:
      Victory Points obtained by the player reaching the Symbol condition required by his Objective card.

    • checkDiagonalPlacement

      public int checkDiagonalPlacement(ObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - The player's own ObjectiveCard.
      Returns:
      Victory Points obtained by the player reaching the diagonalPlacement condition required by his Objective card.

    • skipIndexes

      public boolean skipIndexes(int[][] indexes, int i, int j)
      Determines whether to skip the specified indexes based on their value.

      This method checks the value at the specified indexes in the given 2D array. If the value is 1, the method returns true, indicating that the indexes should be skipped. Otherwise, it returns false. This function is used in other methods of the class to avoid going out of the bounds of the bookMatrix.

      Parameters:
      indexes - the 2D array of indexes to check
      i - the row index to check
      j - the column index to check
      Returns:
      true if the value at the specified indexes is 1, otherwise false

    • checkLPlacement

      public int checkLPlacement(ObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - The player's own ObjectiveCard.
      Returns:
      Victory Points obtained by the player reaching the LPlacement condition required by his Objective card.

    • getBookMatrix

      public Cell[][] getBookMatrix()

    • showMaps

      public String showMaps()
      Displays the current state of the resource and symbol maps.

      This method iterates through the resourceMap and symbolMap, building a string representation of each map. The resulting string shows the names and quantities of each resource and symbol present in the game.

      Returns:
      a string representation of the resource and symbol maps

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Generates a string representation of the book matrix.

      This method constructs a detailed string representation of the book matrix, including row and column indices. It highlights available cells in green and includes the contents of each cell, whether it contains a card or is empty. The method also appends the current state of the resource and symbol maps at the end.

      The matrix display includes:

      • Row and column indices
      • Cell contents or placeholders for empty cells
      • Green highlighting for available cells
      • Resource and symbol maps at the bottom

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the book matrix and the resource/symbol maps

    • nullCardPrint

      public String nullCardPrint()
      Generates a string representation of an empty card.

      This method constructs a string that represents an empty card with a specified width and height, enclosed within a border. The interior of the card is filled with spaces.

      Returns:
      a string representation of an empty card

    • findSubMatrix

      public int[] findSubMatrix()
      Determines the smallest submatrix that contains all the cards in the book matrix.

      This method searches through the bookMatrix to find the smallest rectangular submatrix that includes all cells containing cards. It returns the limits of this submatrix, including a border of one cell around the cards if possible.

      Returns:
      an array of four integers representing the limits of the submatrix: - limits[0]: minimum row index (inclusive) - limits[1]: minimum column index (inclusive) - limits[2]: maximum row index (inclusive) - limits[3]: maximum column index (inclusive)
